messages.subject: food choices and parent's issues
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, Angela wrote: I used to make sure the kids had something healthy before eating sweets, but I gradually started saying yes to any request and I realized
messages.messageBody:
Hello,

Angela wrote: I used to make sure the kids had something healthy before eating sweets, but
I gradually started saying yes to any request and I realized by watching
them that in the end it all worked out anyway."

This is really helpful for me. I think that this kind of thinking will help me say yes more often. Thank-you! At other times of uncertainty, I have journalled (kind of like a food diary) and taken note of whatever it is I'm having a hard time trusting. So, in this case, without the kids noticing, I could journal through a few days or week of theirs (and my) food choices when there were no limits, and probably find at the end of a week that things nutritionally were fine. And, of course, as mentioned numerous times, the kids would be great because they're being trusted.


Michele


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
